nodes.text: Eron was a soldier in the Republic Army during the year 3640 BBY who fought in the Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire. Eron was assigned to Sergeant Shanra Immel's squad and served with Republic Special Forces Division Colonel Jace Malcom during a battle taking place on the Inner Rim planet Kalandis Seven. During the battle Eron and the squad were ordered to destroy the local spaceport and successfully completed their objective.

In 3640 BBY, during the Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire, Eron served as a soldier in the Republic Army. Eron was assigned to Sergeant Shanra Immel's squad and served with SpecForce Colonel Jace Malcom in a battle taking place on Kalandis Seven, a desolate Inner Rim planet covered in fog. During the battle Eron and the squad were tasked with the destruction of the local Sith–controlled spaceport. On the trek to the spaceport, Eron and the squad were attacked, and fellow squad member Corporal Amden vor Keioidian was fatally wounded. Erron's squad leader, Immel, activated Keioidian's med tracer before making the decision to leave him behind, ordering the squad to move out.

Three hours later, Eron, Immel, Malcom, and the rest of the squad reached their objective and went on to plant several targeting beacons, which would allow Republic starfighters to destroy the spaceport regardless of the fog. Eron and the squad succeeded in planting the beacons, and the spaceport was destroyed shortly after.
Eron liked to collect antique music recordings.
Eron first appeared, albeit voice only, in Alexander Freed's short story, The Last Battle of Colonel Jace Malcom, which was published within Star Wars Insider 137 and released on October 23, 2012.
